alert.note: Alert for Shiawassee (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 24 at 9:45PM EDT until August 24 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN SHIAWASSEE COUNTY... At 944 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Swartz Creek to near Byron to near Cohoctah, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe thunderstorms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Shiawassee County, including the following locations... Juddville, Shaftsburg and Vernon. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
